content.description:
Sit start match on a small but good hold, right hand up to a blunt arete, employ some fancy footwork, the crux is rocking over onto your left foot (the start hold); once you stand up it's more or less easy to the top. 



Right of Hugging the Fridge, starts on the SW side of the boulder.

Good righthand crimp for the start, squeeze the fridge-width buttress for a few moves to the top.



This is on the west side of the boulder.

Amazing problem with a challenging crux negotiating around the prow with few footholds and poor handholds. Fully weighted heel hooks will get you through!



This problem starts on the east (downhill) side of the Frigidaire boulder, traverses the arete to the left, around the prow, and then up the south side's edge to the top.

climbs.name: Let Us Now Praise Famous Men

content.description:
The obvious line up the centre remains unfinished but likely in the V6-8 range. The only line of ascent on this boulder is the right side, V-easy, and was used in part to scrub the upper part of the boulder. There are two possible slopey arete problems on this side of the boulder as well.



The east side of the boulder that faces the trail.

There are a cluster of boulders directly off the Raine Creek Nature Walk trail at the point where the trail is closest to the pond. There's been minimal scrubbing and development of a few problems but the potential is high for some good, hard problems here. As with the rest of the rock climbing around town, expect to scrub off moss as traffic is light. Two of the main boulders are listed in this area but, at least for the one, it's named only for the sake of clarification as it hasn't actually been successfully climbed yet by the harder problems. Bears frequent the trail as well and the mosquitoes love the bare and brazen arms of boulderers who have forgotten bug spray. Whatever temps exist around the rest of the world, this corner is always cool due to some kind of pooling, cold, underground air that persists around these boulders, thus the name Frigidaire.
